item.description: CV I am a Data Engineer at CGI in France. I am also a Developer and I am learning and building with Artifical Intelligence and Cloud Computing. Skills Languages Python, R, SQL, Javascript, Java, Scala Machine Learning & Artifical Intelligence Generative AI, Azure AI Services, Azure Machine Learning, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow Web Development Django, Flask, SvelteJs, VueJs, Hugo Data Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Impala, Talend, Pandas, Matplotlib, Tableau Desktop, Power BI Database Systems MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle, MongoDB, HBase Cloud Computing Azure, AWS, Openstack Other Git, Github, Docker, Bash, WSL Work Experience Data Engineer CGI, Tours-France - (Since August 2022) Analysis of customer requirements and existing solutions Design of data integration and transformation solutions Implementation of data integration, transformation and restitution processes Perform tests and code reviews Analysis of production incidents Back‑documentation of existing solutions Internship - Data Engineer Umanis, Tours-France - (January 2022 ~July 2022) Designed data integration solutions Built pipelines for integrating data from different sources into a data hub Built data transformation and restitution pipelines Integration testing Graduate Researcher University of Tours, Blois-France - (Sep 2021 ~ Aug.

item.title: Daxmod
item.description: Daxmod is a toolbox that allows engineers and researchers to perform text classification experiments. It offers modules for data analysis, feature extraction, feature selection, model building and model persistence. Daxmod was built with Python. The source code is available on Github : Daxmod

item.title: Fatal Encounters
item.description: The goal of this post is to explore the Fatal Encounters dataset. First, we defined a set of questions. Then we created graphs to answer these questions and finally, we commented on these graphs. Fatal Encounters documents non-police deaths that occur when police are present or are precipitated by police action or presence. It documents all available records for all 50 states of USA, back to 2000. The general ouline of this post is as follows : Part 1 : Exploration Visualisation based on race Visualization based on state Other visualizations Part 2 : Summary Part 1 : Exploration 1.

item.title: KNN from scratch
item.description: In this project, we implemented the KNN algorithm from scratch on the iris dataset. We implemented the following features : Euclidean distance computing Train et test split Computing of metrics like precision and recall Confusion matrix Cross Validation The project has been implemented in Java and it is available on Github : KNN
